title: Continuity of Useful Action
intent: Maximize value creation by ensuring the system is always performing useful work instead of waiting or idling.

triz_principle.name: Continuity of Useful Action
triz_principle.definition: Carry on work continuously so that all parts of the system are always performing useful functions.

problem_understanding.core_contradiction: We want efficiency, but systems spend large amounts of time waiting, blocked, or idle.
problem_understanding.why_this_hurts: Idle time hides bottlenecks, inflates lead time, and creates the illusion of progress while value is not produced.
typical_signals: queues growing while resources are idle

solution_logic.core_idea: Redesign flow so that useful work continues even when the main path is blocked.
solution_logic.key_rule: Optimize for flow of value, not utilization of steps.
solution_logic.how_it_resolves_the_contradiction: Through parallelization, pre-work, or alternative tasks, the system keeps producing value instead of stalling.

consulting: prepare decision options while approvals are pending
keep a ready backlog of value-adding tasks
software_engineering: work stealing and dynamic task queues
architecture: separation of critical and non-critical paths
enterprise_sap: parallel data preparation while approvals run in MDG
decoupled follow-up processes after master data changes

anti_patterns: busy work that does not create value
masking true bottlenecks with side activities

use_when: lead time is dominated by waiting
teams are blocked by external dependencies
system throughput is low despite high effort
do_not_use_when: parallel work would cause rework or conflicts
strict sequencing is required for correctness

diagnostic_questions: Where does work wait most of the time?
What useful work could continue while waiting?

example.before: Development stops completely while waiting for final approval.
example.after: Non-critical improvements and preparation continue while approvals are pending.
